results.title: Millionaire for a pound
results.brief_description: A satirical impression without spoken commentary, of Surfers’ Paradise. Opening with colour shots of the idyllic countryside views approaching the town, the film quickly transfers to the gaudiness of the town itself with bizarre signs, neon lights and flashy flats. Features a tape-manipulated mouth organ and Beatniks! Rich with the iconography 60’s Australia, this is a fascinating document of the laconic, innocent charms that then characterised Australia’s favourite seaside idyll. Reminiscent of the surrealist social documentary work of Humphrey Jennings.

results.title: Mike and Stefani
results.creator_credit: R. Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Mike and Stefani, a young Ukrainian couple, spent World War II in German labour camps. After the war the couple were reunited and as two of the eight million “displaced persons” in European refugee camps they sought to resettle in Australia. The film had a twofold purpose, to counter the criticism within Australia that post-war immigration procedures for such people were inadequate and that some “undesirables” were slipping through the net, and to encourage Australians to accept the sudden influx of non-British immigrants in the immediate post-war years. Photographer: R.G. Pearse.

results.title: Migration: after eighteen months (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: This is the last film about the Rata family and their emigration from Finland to Australia. It looks at the occurrences of the 18 months stay and the reasons leading to the family’s decision to return home to Finland. It contrasts their expectations with the reality of living in Australia.

results.title: The Middle East: crossroads of three continents
results.brief_description: The scarcity of rainfall and water supply, the significance of being an international crossroad and the importance of rich oil deposits are three key ideas developed in relation to the countries of the Middle East. Their need for water and its effect on their economy is illustrated. The region is considered as a crossroads of peoples, historic cultures and trade. Three-quarters of the world’s reserves of oil are found here; this valuable product has had an important effect on relations of the Middle East with the rest of the world.

results.title: Microscopic fungi
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Hugh O'Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A motion picture camera linked to a microscope uncovers a world of fascinating and colorful activity—the world of fungus growth. Highly magnified color cross-sections of vegetable substances attacked by various kinds of fungi give unusually clear illustrations of how these micro-organisms spread and reproduce, and also show their many useful functions.
